meanings.definition: A discrete quantity of energy proportional in magnitude to the frequency of the radiation it represents.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the quantum of light emitted by the star.
meanings.sent2: She only understood a small quantum of the complex physics theory.
meanings.sent3: The tiny quantum of energy made the light bulb flicker playfully.
meanings.sent4: His smile was a quantum of brightness in the dim room.
meanings.sent5: The quantum of energy in the atom was mesmerizing to observe.

meanings.definition: A particular amount or portion of something, especially a share or an allowance.
meanings.sent1: He received a large quantum of the profits from the business.
meanings.sent2: She needed a small quantum of time to finish the task.
meanings.sent3: The quantum of cake left was just enough for everyone to have a slice.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter added a quantum of joy to the atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The quantum of sugar in the recipe was crucial for its sweetness.
